website_summaries.verdict: One of the best propane grills for anyone looking for a budget option with a lot of cooking space and burners.
pros: We love the solid burners made of stainless steel, which will stand up to extra abuse and outside elements
A convenient extra side burner adds an additional cooking space
cons: Propane hookups can be difficult to use when wet

customer_reviews.title: It will Rust QUICKLY.
customer_reviews.text: Less than 5 days out of the box and it is already starting to rust. Dyna-Glo, you know these things site out doors; it blows my mind that you cant figure out how to prevent rust for a week. Consider hiring an engineer or maybe or any local autobody man.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gas grill, at an even greater price
customer_reviews.text: This easy to build grill features easy to follow, illustrated manual. It is sturdy & has 5 self igniting burners, the cast iron grates once treated will provide many years of rough service.
customer_reviews.author: Billibongg

customer_reviews.title: I won’t buy this again at this high price
customer_reviews.text: For shipping in a box to my house, the assembly was ok, but there are many pieces to keep track of and it took a long time for two people to assemble. I do not think I got the value for my money. At $300, I was expecting higher quality parts. The control knobs are cheap plastic, the grill grates are thinner than expected, the base stand is flimsy with cheap wheels. Heat distribution is not even. The back of the grill cooks much faster than the front of the grill. Very annoying when cooking for a large group.
customer_reviews.author: David Ahl

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: Bought the grill in june of 2018. This is the picture of the pan under the burners rusted completely through in less then 2 years. Also bought the cover to protect the grill. Guess it did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill and Fun to Assemble with my 10 Year old Daughter
customer_reviews.text: We had this shipped to us overseas and it was delivered and packaged really well to withstand the overseas trip. My daughter and I assembled this in about an hour. Well written instructions and easy to follow. I like the heavy duty grilling surface and the ignition is good too. I endorse this product for a good home grill for personal use.
customer_reviews.author: Greg the American Expat in The Philippines

customer_reviews.title: Spring for a Weber
customer_reviews.text: This grill is good value for money on paper, but it's a false savings. The grates are rusted to hell after just a year. For what it will cost to buy replacement grates that often, paying more for a Weber and having something that will last longer is probably better value.
customer_reviews.author: JoshuaLevinson

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Love it, but haven't yet figured out why the side burner doesn't ignite
customer_reviews.author: Leola

customer_reviews.title: Connection line to propane bottle leaks and was replaced within a few days
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this Grill except the connection to the propane bottle leeks and I need that to be replaced. 5/1/20The company immediately replaced the defective line and I'll give them the highest review 4 customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Moose

customer_reviews.title: Great grill for the money..
customer_reviews.text: Grill was very easy to put together, probably took a little over a hour, grill works great. Only bad thing is it was 4 days late getting it. And wish it came with a propane tank. Other than that it's a great grill for the money
customer_reviews.author: Steve Walters

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Came to the house was a big plus. Easy to assemble. Looks nice. Cooks great. Were very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: MPTravels

customer_reviews.title: Best burgers ever- lmwgrilling sizzlin' steak rub
customer_reviews.text: Grilled for the Veteran's on Veteran's day, food was amazing! Hot and low spot's. Overall great for the price- Lmwgrilling.com
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is my second grill of this kind
customer_reviews.text: The grill works well. I replaced the grill part with expanded metal. The expanded metal last longer and I had it cut to fit the grill as a one piece top. . Now I don't have items falling through the grill part
customer_reviews.author: jreaneau

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Had some minor damage that was obviously done before packaging. Was fixable with some washers and minor body work. Otherwise nice grill for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Reising

customer_reviews.title: Good value, large cheap grill
customer_reviews.text: At $305 you would be hard pressed to find a better large grill for this price. PROS - very hot, easy lighting, large grill area, side burner, sturdy frame, temp gauge CONS - light gauge grate not likely to be durable, uneven heat (back hotter than front), cheaply made, unnecessarily difficult to unpack and assemble (38 screws!) Summary - good deal for a very basic grill if you have the patience to put it together. If you have a little more money you should try an infrared like Char-broil Performance TRU-Infared 500 about $395 on Amazon. If not be sure to try the silicone grilling matts.
customer_reviews.author: Wells Turnage

customer_reviews.title: Planned Obsolescence Lives -
customer_reviews.text: All of the innards rusted out within 2 years. Then I found out that they do not offer replacement parts for sale. None. I could not believe it. I received this condescending email from the Company saying that they "hoped I would understand" that they sell their product as a whole. I told them that I hope they understood my feeling that it was a lousy consumer and customer practice and that I would look elsewhere for a replacement. Unsat no matter how you look at it.
customer_reviews.author: FidelisServus

customer_reviews.title: Rust problems
customer_reviews.text: Decent grill but the unit rusts quickly, even under cover The drip tray rotted out completely. A stainless steel pan is available but it should have been stainless or heavier steel from the start Got this as a gift, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Statman

customer_reviews.title: So-so
customer_reviews.text: Pros: good price, great surface area Cons: uneven cooking, racks rusted up after one season, despite always being covered.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Friedman

customer_reviews.title: The drip pan will rust out on you.
customer_reviews.text: Sure it’s a cheap grill but it will rust on you very quickly. Particularly the drip pan that catches all the grease. The darn thing basically disintegrated on me in less than 3 years. They also make it impossible to find a replacement part, I think they’d rather you buy a new grill.
customer_reviews.author: Rommel Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Gets very hot. Good to sear steak then turn down. Not many grills can do that.I
customer_reviews.text: I really like that you can get it very hot to sear steaks then turn it down to finish. You usually have to buy high end grill to get that. Flair ups are not a problem for me. I do have two hot spots in the back side but once you know they are there you can adjust for that. Not the best grill out there but I think best for the price range.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Cotter

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.  Rusts easily.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grill at Home Depot. This grill is hard to regulate the temperature. After a year the drip pan rusted right out. I can't find a replacement part to fit it. I won't buy another Dyno Glo.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Brush

customer_reviews.title: Would never buy this brand again
customer_reviews.text: The catch pan completely rusted out in 2 years. Haven’t been able to find a replacement so the whole grill is going in the garbage. The grill grates were coming apart after a couple years. They use low quality materials
customer_reviews.author: D. M. McGarry

customer_reviews.title: Grease pan deteriorated in a few months
customer_reviews.text: Apparently, you cannot find a replacement grease/drip pan for this grill, which is too bad, as it lasted only a few months with heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: aisle9

customer_reviews.title: Really like it
customer_reviews.text: Best grill I ever owned for the money. 72000 btu’s is more than enough. Solid construction.
customer_reviews.author: R. Johnson

product_meta.title: Dyna-Glo DGB515SDP-D 5 Burner Open Cart Propane Gas Grill
product_meta.description: This quality 5 burner gas grill with side burner combines performance, durability & design. Utilizing 60,000 BTU's over the 483 square" of primary cooking area & heavy Gauge cooking grates, this Dyna-Glo grill has everything the backyard chef needs to grill for family & friends.
feature_bullets: 483 primary cooking area is Square inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars42 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
